candidates.title: Add an `ockam authority create` command
candidates.body:
This PR adds a new command `ockam authority create` to create an Authority node.

An authority node is a node which only starts authentication services (credentials, enrollment tokens, authentification).
Those services are only accessible by first creating a secure channel.

When the Orchestrator has migrated to this command it will be possible to remove the [special casing of the current `ockam node create` command for authority nodes](https://github.com/build-trust/ockam/blob/develop/implementations/rust/ockam/ockam_command/src/node/create.rs#L220).

candidates.title: feat(rust): add examples and about sections to markdown generated docs
fix(rust): update stm32f4xx-hal on `example_projects` to fix resolution of `time` dependency
candidates.body:
Sometimes, when building the project I get the following error:

```bash
Execution failed (exit code 101).
/Users/adrian/.cargo/bin/cargo metadata --verbose --format-version 1 --all-features --filter-platform aarch64-apple-darwin
stdout :     Updating crates.io index
error: failed to select a version for `time`.
    ... required by package `ockam_identity v0.70.0 (/Users/adrian/projects/ockam/ockam/implementations/rust/ockam/ockam_identity)`
    ... which satisfies path dependency `ockam_identity` (locked to 0.70.0) of package `ockam v0.82.0 (/Users/adrian/projects/ockam/ockam/implementations/rust/ockam/ockam)`
    ... which satisfies path dependency `ockam` (locked to 0.82.0) of package `hello_ockam_no_std v0.1.0 (/Users/adrian/projects/ockam/ockam/implementations/rust/ockam/ockam_examples/example_projects/no_std)`
versions that meet the requirements `^0.3.20` are: 0.3.20

all possible versions conflict with previously selected packages.

  previously selected package `time v0.3.19`
    ... which satisfies dependency `time = "^0.3.14"` (locked to 0.3.19) of package `stm32f4xx-hal v0.14.0`
    ... which satisfies dependency `stm32f4xx-hal = "^0.14.0"` (locked to 0.14.0) of package `hello_ockam_no_std v0.1.0 (/Users/adrian/projects/ockam/ockam/implementations/rust/ockam/ockam_examples/example_projects/no_std)`

failed to select a version for `time` which could resolve this conflict
```

Looks like, depending on the order of how cargo resolves dependencies (??), building `stm32f4xx-hal` locks `time` to `0.3.19`, which conflicts with the requirement of other crates for `time` being `^0.3.20`.

candidates.title: feat(rust): create an authority node
candidates.body:
The purpose of this PR is to create a small binary representing an authority node (a node which authenticates identity attributes and issues credentials).

# Current situation

At the moment when we start an authority node we actually start a full node with many services. In particular, there is an unrestricted TCP listener started just to receive commands (to create inlets, outlets etc...).

# Proposed solution

This PR provides a node:

 - with a TCP listener which can only be used to create secure channels
 - starting only services related to the role of an authority

The authority node is started exactly as before in order to keep the Orchestrator deployment working
```
ockam node create \
  --tcp-listener-address=0.0.0.0:4200 \ 
  --launch-config=/mnt/storage/authority-conf.json \
  --reload-from-trusted-identities-file=/mnt/storage/trust-anchors.json \
  authority
```

In the command above the specific presence of `--launch-config` and `authority` as a node name will start a restricted authority node. The next step is to provide an independent `ockam authority create` command specifically for the authority node use case.

candidates.title: build: bump stm32f4xx-hal from 0.14.0 to 0.15.0
candidates.body:
Bumps [stm32f4xx-hal](https://github.com/stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal) from 0.14.0 to 0.15.0.
Release notes

Sourced from stm32f4xx-hal's releases.

v0.15.0

What's Changed

  • add features to readme by @​burrbull in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#561
  • clippy 1.66 by @​burrbull in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#562
  • OutputPort by @​burrbull in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#426
  • restore erased pin by @​burrbull in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#563
  • delay-syst-blinky example: us toggle by @​rursprung in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#568
  • clippy, bump usb by @​burrbull in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#575
  • Fix alternate function pin definitions for FMPI2C1 by @​ElliottWatermanBOSS in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#572
  • Pwm complementary by @​burrbull in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#571
  • Fix SDIO hardware flow control errata by @​chemicstry in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#577
  • update vscode settings by @​burrbull in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#579
  • read/write dead_time by @​burrbull in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#578
  • missing sai feature by @​burrbull in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#580
  • nb by @​burrbull in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#582
  • First part of advanced timer dead time feature documentation by @​janschiefer in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#581
  • Add GPIO speed into SPI example, improve docs. by @​qwerty19106 in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#576
  • Comment buffer usage in adc_dma_rtic example by @​9names in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#532
  • Add public method to set SSI by @​imihajlow in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#543

New Contributors

  • @​ElliottWatermanBOSS made their first contribution in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#572
  • @​janschiefer made their first contribution in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#581
  • @​qwerty19106 made their first contribution in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#576
  • @​9names made their first contribution in stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#532

Full Changelog: https://github.com/stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal/compare/v0.14.0...v0.15.0

Changelog

Sourced from stm32f4xx-hal's changelog.

[v0.15.0] - 2023-03-13

Changed

  • Bump nb to 1.1
  • Bump synopsys-usb-otg to 0.3.2 (bug fix) #575
  • Update readme, clippy fixes
  • Added possibility to pass complementary pins to Pwm and change pwm channel polarity #571, set dead time and idle state for advanced timers #578 #581

Added

  • Docs in rtic-adc-dma example #532
  • OutPortX (X = 2..8) and OutPortArray structures which can handle several pins at once #426
  • restore for ErasedPin and PartiallyErasedPin #563
  • Added a public method to set SSI bit in SPI. #543

Fixed

  • spi-dma example pins speed
  • Fix alternate function pin definitions for FMPI2C1 #572
  • Fix SDIO hardware flow control errata #577

#426: stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#426 #532: stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#532 #543: stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#543 #563: stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#563 #571: stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#571 #572: stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#572 #575: stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#575 #577: stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#577 #578: stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#578 #581: stm32-rs/stm32f4xx-hal#581

Commits
  • ee4c133 Merge #583
  • 66b28f2 release 0.15
  • 4a54d09 Merge #543
  • 4d0898a Add public method to set SSI
  • f1581de Merge #532
  • 4b5ad88 Comment buffer usage in adc_dma_rtic example
  • d2b0266 Merge #576
  • 367230c changelog
  • de18e51 Merge #581
  • c053b7a changelog

## Current behavior

<!-- Please describe the current behavior of the code before the changes in this pull request is applied. -->

The multiaddr_to_socket_addr is a static function that operates on a MultiAddr.

## Proposed changes

<!-- Please describe the changes proposed in this pull request. -->
<!-- If this pull request resolves an already recorded bug or a feature request, please add a link to that issue. -->

candidates.title: build: bump open from 3.4.0 to 4.0.0
candidates.body:
Bumps [open](https://github.com/Byron/open-rs) from 3.4.0 to 4.0.0.
Release notes

Sourced from open's releases.

v4.0.0

Bug Fixes

  • Windows URL encoding for multiple query params Previously, passing a URL with multiple query parameters on Windows would result in improper escaping, causing unexpected behavior when using it with "cmd /c". This commit addresses this issue by properly escaping all query parameters in the URL. Now, URLs with multiple query parameters are handled correctly on Windows.

    See also:

    • https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/os/windows/process/trait.CommandExt.html#tymethod.raw_arg
    • https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/cmd
    • https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/start

    Related Byron/open-rs#67.

New Features (BREAKING)

  • set minimal required Rust version of 1.62. This version is motivated only when compiling on windows (but we can't differentiate that) due to the recent addition of CommandExt::raw_arg().

    This might be a breaking change as previously there was no minimal supported Rust version.

Commit Statistics

  • 4 commits contributed to the release.
  • 3 days passed between releases.
  • 2 commits were understood as conventional.
  • 0 issues like '(#ID)' were seen in commit messages

Commit Details

  • Uncategorized
    • Windows URL encoding for multiple query params (9ceb0a4)
    • Refactor (9a1178a)
    • Set minimal required Rust version of 1.62. (0cd6f98)
    • Fix Windows URL encoding for multiple query params (e4856ac)
Changelog

Sourced from open's changelog.

4.0.0 (2023-03-10)

Bug Fixes

  • Windows URL encoding for multiple query params Previously, passing a URL with multiple query parameters on Windows would result in improper escaping, causing unexpected behavior when using it with "cmd /c". This commit addresses this issue by properly escaping all query parameters in the URL. Now, URLs with multiple query parameters are handled correctly on Windows.

    See also:

    • https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/os/windows/process/trait.CommandExt.html#tymethod.raw_arg
    • https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/cmd
    • https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/start

    Related Byron/open-rs#67.

New Features (BREAKING)

  • set minimal required Rust version of 1.62. This version is motivated only when compiling on windows (but we can't differentiate that) due to the recent addition of CommandExt::raw_arg().

    This might be a breaking change as previously there was no minimal supported Rust version.

Commit Statistics

  • 4 commits contributed to the release.
  • 3 days passed between releases.
  • 2 commits were understood as conventional.
  • 0 issues like '(#ID)' were seen in commit messages

Commit Details

  • Uncategorized
    • Windows URL encoding for multiple query params (9ceb0a4)
    • Refactor (9a1178a)
    • Set minimal required Rust version of 1.62. (0cd6f98)
    • Fix Windows URL encoding for multiple query params (e4856ac)
Commits
  • f36f37a Release open v4.0.0
  • 9ceb0a4 fix: Windows URL encoding for multiple query params
  • 9a1178a refactor
  • 0cd6f98 feat!: set minimal required Rust version of 1.62.
  • e4856ac Fix Windows URL encoding for multiple query params
  • See full diff in compare view

candidates.title: build: bump libc from 0.2.139 to 0.2.140
candidates.body:
Bumps [libc](https://github.com/rust-lang/libc) from 0.2.139 to 0.2.140.
Release notes

Sourced from libc's releases.

0.2.140

What's Changed

  • linux-like: add AT_RECURSIVE constant by @​lucab in rust-lang/libc#3043
  • Set correct FD_SETSIZE for espidf by @​zRedShift in rust-lang/libc#3054
  • Fix Fuchsia target names by @​JohnTitor in rust-lang/libc#3059
  • PIDFD_NONBLOCK addition into uclibc. by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3029
  • linux add scheduler core for prctl constants by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3055
  • linux-like: add OPEN_TREE_CLONE and OPEN_TREE_CLOEXEC by @​lucab in rust-lang/libc#3048
  • adding mimmutable from openbsd (7.3) by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3063
  • Fix compile error for riscv64-linux-android by @​colincross in rust-lang/libc#3064
  • android: add missing syscall constants by @​lucab in rust-lang/libc#3062
  • haiku posix layer adding locale flavor of strcasecmp api by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3069
  • linux: add pthread barriers by @​Forestryks in rust-lang/libc#3065
  • netbsd 10 adding getentropy/getrandom. by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3071
  • Ignore some ABI changed fns on macOS by @​JohnTitor in rust-lang/libc#3077
  • Add struct ctl_info by @​siegfried in rust-lang/libc#3046
  • linux: add additional netlink interface attribute tags by @​tones111 in rust-lang/libc#3053
  • Add pthread_main_np on Apple targets by @​madsmtm in rust-lang/libc#3079
  • uclibc/mips: add O_NOATIME & O_PATH constant by @​cppcoffee in rust-lang/libc#3058
  • linux/uclibc: resync syscall tables by @​lucab in rust-lang/libc#3061
  • freebsd 14 add ptrace_sc_remote. by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3073
  • netbsd 10 event api update. by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3080
  • linux glibc update arm64 HWCAP2 list including the last 6.1 kernel en… by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3081
  • adding specific freebsd signal constants by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3082
  • Add getentropy for Emscripten by @​kleisauke in rust-lang/libc#3087
  • netbsd 10 add ppoll api support by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3083
  • uclibc/mips: add missing O_LARGEFILE constant by @​cppcoffee in rust-lang/libc#3088
  • add user_regs for linux on arm by @​Freax13 in rust-lang/libc#3072
  • linux: add PTRACE_SYSCALL_INFO_* by @​mbyzhang in rust-lang/libc#3074
  • linux: add PR_SET_PTRACER_ANY by @​howjmay in rust-lang/libc#3086
  • uclibc/mips: add missing constant by @​cppcoffee in rust-lang/libc#3092
  • m68k: Fix incorrect type for sigaction::sa_flags by @​glaubitz in rust-lang/libc#3078
  • Solaris/Illumos: use correct types for getrandom(2) flags by @​josephlr in rust-lang/libc#3090
  • Upgrade FreeBSD 14 image by @​JohnTitor in rust-lang/libc#3096
  • ANDROID: Add syncfs API in liblibc by @​shikhapanwar in rust-lang/libc#3060
  • add SO_TS_* constants for FreeBSD by @​folkertdev in rust-lang/libc#3098
  • uclibc/mips: add more missing constant by @​cppcoffee in rust-lang/libc#3094
  • pidfile util api for freebsd addition. by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3099
  • freebsd add initial sctp support by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3101
  • uclibc/mips: add missing MAP_HUGETLB constant by @​cppcoffee in rust-lang/libc#3100
  • xous: add initial C definitions by @​xobs in rust-lang/libc#3084
  • freebsd further sctp support. by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3102
  • apple add pthread_stack_frame_decode_np by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3105
  • linux tcp adding TCP_MD5SIG_MAXKEYLEN const. by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3107
  • linux: add more constants and FUTEX_OP for futex by @​voskh0d in rust-lang/libc#3109
  • linux starting adding sctp support by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3095
  • freebsd tcp_info data addition. by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3112
  • netbsd tcp_info data addition. by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3113
  • FreeBSD: move all new ABI to base module, add more O_ flags by @​valpackett in rust-lang/libc#3114
  • freebsd sctp support part 3 by @​devnexen in rust-lang/libc#3118

... (truncated)

Commits
  • ad7bbf4 Auto merge of #3141 - Amanieu:v0.2.140, r=JohnTitor
  • 34e9a5e Auto merge of #3143 - connor4312:add-errno, r=JohnTitor
  • 89ec881 Auto merge of #3037 - ferrocene:pa-check-cfg, r=JohnTitor
  • d63eedc compatibility with rust 1.13.0
  • 9d3281b wasi: add __errno_location
  • 3363d43 Auto merge of #3142 - connor4312:wasi-irwx, r=JohnTitor
  • 4b4cd15 add S_IRWX* constants to wasi
  • b9a49d4 add ci job to test check-cfg
  • e74f735 support extra check-cfg
  • b636da0 emit rustc-check-cfg in the build script when LIBC_CHECK_CFG=1
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: fix(rust): fixed compatibility with older kafka protocol versions
candidates.body:
## Current behavior

When older Kafka clients are used, the decoding of Kafka packets breaks, closing the connection.

## Proposed changes

Fixed a bug during encoding and decoding of request and response headers.
The header version doesn't depend solely on the API version, but it also depends on the type of message and whether it's a request or a response.
